report_title: Industry Research: Online Recruitment Sites in the US
executive_summary: The Online Recruitment Sites industry has boomed since the 2000s as job searches have moved online and the internet has become an indispensable part of daily life. The internet has become the primary medium for communicating and accessing information, the main driving force behind this industry's rise. Job seekers and employers have increasingly turned to online.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Recruitment Sites Generate Revenue Across Multiple Streams
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online recruitment sites maintain databases of job openings, resumes and various other business analytics to help strengthen the transparency, efficiency and responsiveness of the labor market. Companies earn revenue by charging employers fees to list job openings. Websites also generate revenue through various other avenues, such as ad placement on job listings. Companies also offer secondary services like career advice, interview preparation, resume building, job alerts and professional networking opportunities.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Businesses Now Depend on Online Recruitment Sites to Fill Positions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Success depends on changes to the national unemployment rate, corporate restructuring activity and overall need for labor. The strength, expansion and high turnover of the US labor market has driven the need for online recruitment sites, which have quickly become a major channel for hiring at the expense of more traditional recruiting channels like employment agencies or staffing companies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Has Grown Among Economic Peaks and Recession
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A greater proportion of these new hires have stemmed from online job postings since the cost of searching for work and recruiting employees is much lower than traditional recruiting methods. Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, strong economic growth and a rise in business sentiment led to greater hiring. While these trends contributed to considerable growth, there was a significant deceleration in global economic activity as the pandemic took hold.

The accelerated growth in internet traffic has translated into a larger market for companies, encouraging the development of new value-added services beyond traditional online resume collection and ad-driven job listings. Rapid developments in mobile computing platforms and big data analytics have enabled online recruitment sites to analyze and track candidate profiles more effectively than ever before.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Intensifying Competition Continues to Ramp Up
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Internal competition will continue to intensify as online recruitment sites find new ways to differentiate themselves. Price competition will remain rampant as more sites enter the fray, forcing existing sites to price and eat into profitability to help maintain clients. An influx of niche websites will continue to enter, catering to a specific portion of the job market. Some examples include websites that only focus on startups or venture capital.

An the expansion of the domestic economy, as well as the recovery of the global economy from COVID-19, will influence job placements and revenue for online recruitment sites moving forward. Expanding corporate profit will encourage businesses to reinvest excess profits in growing their businesses and hiring new workers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TECHNOLOGY WILL CONTINUE TO PLAY A PIVOTAL ROLE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Online recruitment sites will implement cutting-edge technologies to stand out amid rising competition and provide value-added services. Artificial intelligence and machine learning will help improve both sides of its member-recruiter ecosystem by giving its members applicable job recommendations and assisting recruiters in finding new talent pools.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Research and Development Helps Enhance User Experience
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Monster launched its 6Sense platform, which uses computer algorithms to quickly match a specific candidate's qualifications to the most appropriate job position. Similar technological developments and partnerships will drive growth throughout the outlook period. The three largest companies will continue to invest heavily in their online recruitment platforms to gain additional users and increase their stranglehold on the market.

industry_definition: Online recruitment sites primarily charge employers to list job openings, though they may also earn revenue via ad placement on job listings. Companies also design and maintain databases of resumes and candidate profiles for use by employers and other recruitment agencies. Companies in this industry are based entirely online; therefore, traditional recruiting agencies and staffing companies are not included.
key_trends: The industry is characterized by moderate-to-high level of market share concentration. It is difficult for upstart sites to take market share away from the top players.
Top companies like LinkedIn and Indeed use AI and ML to improve their member-recruiter ecosystem. This has the effect of giving job-seekers more applicable leads and recruiters a new talent pool.
The internet has become the primary medium for communicating and accessing information. This is one of the driving forces behind this industry's rise.
Improving labor markets will create new job openings. Small- and medium-sized businesses are the most likely to hire more workers as the economy continues to grow.

Microsoft, LinkedIn's parent company, recently announced its multiyear, multibillion-dollar investment in OpenAI. Benefits from the artificial intelligence research platform are expected to trickle down to LinkedIn.
The three largest companies are constantly battling to gain market share.
Presenting job seekers with the most relevant matches and recruiters with new talent pools is imperative to coming out on top.
The state of the economy and the unemployment rate play are fundamental in shaping workforce trends.
A decline in unemployment likely indicates there has been an increase in job placements.
The industry is highly regulated with regard to the collection, storage and use of personal data.
Regulation is increasing as consumers are becoming more concerned about protecting personal information.
Profit expansion has slowed in recent years.
An increase in price-based competition has limited the pricing strategies of online recruitment sites, slimming margins.
Wages have declined as a share of revenue since the industry's inception as revenue has boomed.
Still, online sites depend on highly skilled workers to develop products and maintain services.
California holds more online recruitment sites than any other state.
Access to a highly-knowledgeable pool of laborers is the main reason why tech firms locate in the state.
New York is the second most popular state for online recruitment sites.
The state is the financial capital of the world and several online recruitment sites provide industry-relevant services to the niche market.
Demand for health care and social assistance jobs has increased.
The COVID-19 pandemic placed greater emphasis on the importance of the sector.
Goods-producing sectors and trade-based roles have had difficulty attracting workers.
These sectors have experienced the significant workforce shortages because of the growing emphasis on obtaining a four-year degree.
Individuals with advanced degrees have experienced an increase in employment.
These positions also tend to be more lucrative because individuals have more education and experience relative to others.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals with a high school diploma or less
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment measures the number of employees with a high school diploma or less relative to employees with at least some college. Individuals with a high school diploma or less make up the largest share of the workforce. More individuals are pursuing a college education than ever before to earn more money and have greater life satisfaction.

Due to the nature of many individuals attending a four-year college upon graduating high school, it comes as no surprise that a large portion of jobs listed online mandate a candidate hold at least a Bachelors' degree. Sectors such as professional services, healthcare, and financial services typically require its candidates to possess at least a Bachelor's degree.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals with some college or an associate's degree
market_segmentation.segment_description: Individuals in this segment possess either an Associate's degree, some education at a four-year college, a high school diploma or less. While many employers prefer candidates with Bachelor's degrees, there are still a wide range of jobs that employers need to fill that do not require a candidate to possess a four-year degree.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals with a master's degree or higher
market_segmentation.segment_description: Only a portion of individuals who receive their Bachelor's degree decide to continue their studies and pursue a Master's degree or another more advanced degree. The advanced skills and experiences learned from additional coursework are highly valued by employers.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment consists of job openings within the following sectors: Professional, Scientific and Technical Services (IBISWorld sector 54) Management of Companies and Enterprises (55) Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services (56).

The Healthcare and Social Assistance sector (62) includes online job positions for pharmacists, nurse practitioners, therapists and other healthcare and technical professionals. This segment has grown in size, driven by an increase in healthcare expenditure and growing access to private health insurance.
The Retail Trade sector (44-45) includes entry-level and mid-managerial positions within retail outlets such as department stores, gas stations and mass merchandisers.
This segment consists of job openings within the following sectors: Arts, Entertainment and Recreation (71) and Accommodation and Food Services (72).
The Manufacturing sector (31-33) includes assembly line jobs and the warehousing, procurement, inventory and related tasks required to produce goods on an industrial scale.
This segment consists of job openings within the following sectors: Finance and Insurance (52) and Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53).

This segment consists of job openings within all other sectors, including Construction (23), Transportation and Warehousing (48-49), Wholesale Trade (42), Information (51), Agriculture (11), Mining (21), Utilities (22) and all other.

Business Analytics & Enterprise Software Publishing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US

tier_2_buyers: Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of broadband connections in the United States represents the total number of internet connection points (both fixed and mobile) with a speed of over 200.0 kilobits per second in at least one direction. An increase in the number of broadband connections reflects how heavily consumers rely on the internet to complete everyday tasks, such as looking for jobs.

business_locations.location_description: While it is not known as a historical tech hub, the Southeast has grown into a hotbed for technology companies. A large portion of the region's growing presence in the industry can be attributed to Virginia, which accounts for 1.9% of industry establishments.
New York state leads the region by number of establishments and ranks third nationwide among all states.

The West region includes California, which has by far the largest share of establishments of any state. The major business hubs of Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Diego and Sacramento make California a prime location to start a business.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Act and similar laws prohibit employers and job postings from discriminating on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation and physical or mental disabilities.
The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) gives consumers more awareness and control over the use of their personal information by businesses.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Compliance with federal and state laws is important for online recruitment sites. Tightening government regulations regarding privacy and data usage pose a barrier to new entrants.
Start-up costs for online recruitment sites are low, and establishing a domain and paying for bandwidth are insignificant expenses, especially for companies.

basis_points.basis_description: The most significant online recruitment sites hold a considerable portion of the available market share, making it difficult for smaller companies to compete in the industry.
The industry has a high level of labor intensity and skilled workers are necessary for numerous tasks like product development and software engineering.

concentration_points.concentration_title: FIRST MOVER ADVANTAGE HAS BENEFITED INDUSTRY LEADERS
concentration_points.concentration_description: Recruit, LinkedIn and CareerBuilder were among the first companies to launch an online recruitment site and establish a significant member base. The first-mover advantage has helped these companies achieve strong brand recognition and product loyalty.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Quality of Service and User Experience
concentration_points.concentration_description: Employers, job seekers and recruiters are particularly attracted by these sites because they have a large consumer base and strong branding and reputation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Significant purchases include new hardware or software used to develop websites, recruitment tools and other network infrastructure.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor remains essential even as wage costs have shrunk
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are paid out to product developers, software engineers, marketing associates, account managers and, to a lesser extent, consultants.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other costs rise as a share of revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs include general overhead costs (e.g., telecommunication and outsourced IT duties) and legal and insurance services.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Rapid growth is contributing to volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Online Recruitment Sites have been subject to a moderate degree of revenue volatility on account of the industry's rapid growth.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Booms and busts of the economy drive turbulence
volatility_points.volatility_description: Because online recruitment sites match job seekers with open positions, changes to either side of the labor market can have significant ramifications for the industry.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online recruitment sites are constantly exploring new ways of applying cutting-edge technologies to make their content more personalized based on likes, interests and backgrounds.
AI and machine learning have been imperative to improving both sides of its member-recruiter ecosystem.
Recruitment sites invest heavily to understand how users engage with their platforms.

FAQs.question: Which business sector accounts for the largest share of your company's revenue?
How do you market your services to potential clients? Has this changed during the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Online job recruitment sites advertise their services to employers through all classic media channels.

FAQs.question: Does your company target a particular market segment, or provide for a broad range of markets?
FAQs.answer: Smaller online recruitment sites tend to focus on job listings for one particular sector that the company has a particular relationship and understanding of.

FAQs.question: Is maintaining repeat or recurring customers vital to your company's success?
FAQs.answer: Retaining large clients is vitally important to online recruitment sites because often times these are large businesses with a large quantity of jobs that need to be filled.

FAQs.question: Are web-based technologies, such as online document storage and video conferencing hurting your business?
FAQs.answer: Due to the scalability of online technology, online recruitment sites are expected to benefit from reduced costs.
